Description: How have “omic” technologies led to the discovery of novel oncopathogens and new disease subgroups with potential clinical implications? This session offers an opportunity to highlight recent advances in the identification and characterization of pathogen-associated cancers using modern next generation sequencing technologies. In particular, current data on new biological subtypes of pathogen-associated cancers and their clinical implications will be presented. Novel therapeutic opportunities arising from these recent discoveries will also be discussed.
SearchResultBody: SY11. Multiomics Approaches for Novel Oncopathogen Discovery and Related Mechanisms
Title: Multiomics Approaches for Novel Oncopathogen Discovery and Related Mechanisms
